hypothesis_content.title: Low Volatility Preceding Macro Liquidity Event Signals High Post-Event Directional Resolve
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 10-day realized volatility of BTC is in the bottom quartile of its 1-year range immediately BEFORE a major, scheduled macro liquidity event (Fed QT decision, Treasury issuance announcement), the initial 3-day price move post-event will continue in the same direction for the subsequent 7 days with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Exceptionally low volatility indicates a coiled market with pent-up order flow and divergent views. A major liquidity event acts as a catalyst that resolves this tension. The initial move represents the market's consensus interpretation of the liquidity impact. Low prior volatility suggests weak counter-trend positioning, allowing the new trend to persist as participants adjust.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day realized volatility is in its lowest 25% over the past 252 trading days
A major, scheduled macro liquidity event is due within 24 hours
BTC price establishes a clear >2% move in one direction within the first 3 trading days POST-event

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10 total days have passed since the macro event
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through the closing price of day 3 post-event

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The probability of a 3-day post-event move continuing over the next 7 days is <55% when pre-event volatility is in the bottom quartile.
